title: PyRVA 2.0 Fireside Chat
description:
"Come for the language, stay for the community."

Following our last meeting, we wanted to take some time to connect with our members and find out what you think would make this community better. The organizers will share some of the ideas we've had, but we want to hear from you. This will be an open forum where there are no bad ideas.

Some questions to get you thinking:

  • What do you like about PyRVA? What do you dislike?
  • What other communities do you participate in? What do you like about them?
  • What kind of social events interest you?
  • Would you like PyRVA to provide food? If so, what kinds?
  • What meeting times would work best for your schedule?

Schedule
6:30 pm - Doors Open / Socializing
7:00 pm - PyRVA 2.0 Vision
7:15 pm - Group Discussion
9:00 pm - Prologue (Social in Scotts Addition)

All events are open to all skill levels . If you're just starting out, come to learn and feel free to ask questions. That's where the real learning happens. If you're a more seasoned developer, we'd love to learn from you. Despite what the Zen of Python says, there are usually more than one way to do something, so share your knowledge!

Join our Discord server! https://pyrva.org/discord
Want to sponsor PyRVA? https://pyrva.org/donate
Want to present? https://forms.gle/q8w3xziArWjud5f67

title: Data Analytics with Pandas
description:
Our own Paul Joireman will be presenting on performing Data Analyses using the Pandas library!

***

PyRVA Meets twice a month. Feel free to come early and ask questions or hang out. After each meeting, we will generally hang out for a bit and can also answer any questions.

Lecture Night: first Tuesday of the month

We bring speakers in from around the country to teach us something new about Python. You'll be able to ask the speaker(s) any questions about the topic.

Let us know if you would like to present at a future meeting! https://forms.gle/q8w3xziArWjud5f67

Coding Night: Third Tuesday of the month

Here you will find the Python challenge problems and projects that we will solve together in small groups. Please contact an organizer if you're interested in proposing a project or topic.

title: PyRVA Social Night - Richmond Flying Squirrels
description:
Join PyRVA for a night at the ballpark and cheer on the Richmond Flying Squirrels!

We'll sit in the General Admission area so it will be easy to get seats together. $10/person ahead of time, $12/person day-of. Feel free to bring your family along for the fun!

Grab your tickets here: https://www.milb.com/richmond/schedule/2024-07
